notes: US-market name for Audi 80 B2 (1978–1986). Available quattro AWD from 1983. Inline-five engine on quattro models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi 80 article, January 2025 revision.
US-market Audi 80 with quattro AWD (B2, 1985–1987). Inline-five engine. Manual transmission only. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi 80 article, January 2025 revision.

US-market name for Audi 100/200 C3 (1982–1991). Available turbo and quattro AWD. Inline-five engines. Subject to unintended acceleration recalls in mid-1980s. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi 100 article, January 2025 revision.
Post-5000 rebranding of Audi 100/200 C3 (1982–1991). Available turbo and quattro AWD. Higher-output 220 hp on 200 quattro. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi 100 article, January 2025 revision.
Third generation Audi 80/90 (B3, 1986–1991). Available quattro AWD on higher trims (90 quattro). Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi 80 article, January 2025 revision.

Original Audi quattro (Typ 85, 1980–1991). Revolutionary AWD performance coupe. Turbocharged inline-five engine. Rally homologation special. Manual transmission only. Limited US availability. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi quattro article, January 2025 revision.
US-market Audi Coupe based on B2 platform (1980–1987). FWD only in US. Inline-five engine. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi Coupe article, January 2025 revision.
First generation Audi V8 (D11, 1988–1993). First Audi with V8 engine. quattro AWD standard. Aluminum engine. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi V8 article, January 2025 revision.
